diseases.name: Mild Sinus Pressure
diseases.description: Minor sinus congestion causing minimal discomfort, usually relieved by over-the-counter decongestants.
diseases.symptomDetails: Slight pressure around eyes and forehead, minor facial tenderness

diseases.name: Eye Strain
diseases.description: Caused by prolonged screen time or reading. Rest and proper lighting usually provide relief.
diseases.symptomDetails: Tired eyes, slight headache behind eyes, difficulty focusing

diseases.name: Tension Headache
diseases.description: The most common type of headache causing mild to moderate pain and a feeling of tightness or pressure around the head. Often caused by stress, anxiety, poor posture, or muscle tension.
diseases.symptomDetails: Dull, aching head pain, sensation of tightness or pressure across the forehead or on the sides and back of the head, tenderness on the scalp, neck and shoulder muscles

diseases.name: Sinus Infection
diseases.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing significant facial pain and pressure, often requiring antibiotics if bacterial.
diseases.symptomDetails: Facial pain and pressure, thick nasal discharge, reduced sense of smell, cough, fever

diseases.name: Migraine Headache
diseases.description: Severe headache disorder causing intense throbbing pain, often accompanied by nausea and extreme sensitivity to stimuli. Can last hours to days and significantly impacts daily activities.
diseases.symptomDetails: Throbbing, pulsating pain usually on one side, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to sound or light, visual disturbances (aura), numbness or tingling

diseases.name: Severe Migraine with Aura
diseases.description: Advanced migraine with neurological symptoms preceding the headache. Requires prescription medication and often needs darkened, quiet environment.
diseases.symptomDetails: Intense throbbing pain, visual disturbances, temporary vision loss, severe nausea, vomiting, extreme light and sound sensitivity

diseases.name: Cluster Headache
diseases.description: Extremely painful headache occurring in clusters or cycles. Pain is focused around one eye and is often described as the worst pain imaginable.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe burning or piercing pain around one eye, eye redness and tearing, nasal congestion, restlessness, agitation

diseases.name: Acute Temporal Arteritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of temporal arteries causing severe headache. Medical emergency requiring immediate treatment to prevent vision loss.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe throbbing temple pain, scalp tenderness, jaw pain when chewing, vision problems, fever, fatigue

diseases.name: Severe Meningitis
diseases.description: Life-threatening inflammation of brain and spinal cord membranes. Requires immediate emergency medical attention and hospitalization.
diseases.symptomDetails: Extreme headache, severe neck stiffness, high fever, confusion, sensitivity to light, vomiting, altered mental state

diseases.name: Brain Hemorrhage
diseases.description: Medical emergency involving bleeding in the brain. The worst headache of one's life requiring immediate emergency intervention. Can be fatal without rapid treatment.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden, severe thunderclap headache, loss of consciousness, seizures, severe confusion, weakness or numbness, difficulty speaking

diseases.name: Minor Muscle Soreness
diseases.description: Normal delayed-onset muscle soreness (DOMS) from physical activity. Usually resolves with rest in 24-48 hours.
diseases.symptomDetails: Mild aching in arm muscles, slight stiffness after exercise

diseases.name: Mild Tendonitis
diseases.description: Early-stage inflammation of tendons causing mild discomfort. Rest, ice, and anti-inflammatory medication usually sufficient.
diseases.symptomDetails: Slight pain when moving arm, minor swelling, tenderness to touch

diseases.name: Cubital Tunnel Syndrome (mild)
diseases.description: Compression of ulnar nerve at elbow causing nerve symptoms. Often responds to activity modification and splinting.
diseases.symptomDetails: Tingling in ring and little fingers, occasional numbness, mild elbow discomfort

diseases.name: Moderate Bursitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of bursa sacs causing moderate pain and reduced mobility. May require corticosteroid injection.
diseases.symptomDetails: Noticeable shoulder or elbow pain, swelling, warmth, limited range of motion

diseases.name: Rotator Cuff Strain
diseases.description: Partial tear or strain of rotator cuff muscles causing substantial pain and functional limitation. Physical therapy often required.
diseases.symptomDetails: Significant shoulder pain, difficulty raising arm, pain at night, weakness in arm

diseases.name: Severe Bicep Tendon Tear
diseases.description: Rupture of bicep tendon causing marked pain and deformity. Often requires surgical evaluation and repair.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe pain, visible bruising, bulge in arm (Popeye sign), significant weakness

diseases.name: Acute Compartment Syndrome
diseases.description: Medical emergency where increased pressure in muscle compartment reduces blood flow. Requires emergency surgical decompression.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe pain disproportionate to injury, tight swelling, numbness, pale or dark skin, severe weakness

diseases.name: Severe Compound Fracture
diseases.description: Open fracture with bone breaking through skin. Surgical emergency requiring immediate medical attention to prevent infection and restore function.
diseases.symptomDetails: Extreme pain, visible bone through skin, severe bleeding, deformity, shock symptoms

diseases.name: Acute Arterial Occlusion
diseases.description: Complete blockage of arm artery causing tissue death. Vascular emergency requiring immediate surgery to restore blood flow.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe pain, cold pale arm, no pulse, paralysis, loss of sensation

diseases.name: Severe Crush Injury
diseases.description: Catastrophic trauma with extensive soft tissue, nerve, and vascular damage. Life-threatening injury requiring immediate emergency intervention.
diseases.symptomDetails: Unbearable pain, massive tissue damage, severe bleeding, shock, potential amputation needed

diseases.name: Mild Overuse Soreness
diseases.description: Common soreness from repetitive motions like typing or sports. Resolves with rest and gentle stretching.
diseases.symptomDetails: Light aching after repetitive activities, mild stiffness in forearm

diseases.name: Early Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
diseases.description: Nerve compression in wrist causing intermittent symptoms. Often managed with wrist splints and ergonomic adjustments.
diseases.symptomDetails: Occasional tingling in thumb and fingers, mild hand numbness at night

diseases.name: Tennis Elbow
diseases.description: Lateral epicondylitis causing elbow pain from overuse. Responds to rest, ice, and physical therapy.
diseases.symptomDetails: Pain on outside of elbow, weak grip strength, pain when lifting objects

diseases.name: Moderate Wrist Sprain
diseases.description: Torn or stretched wrist ligaments causing significant discomfort. May require immobilization with brace or cast.
diseases.symptomDetails: Noticeable wrist pain, swelling, bruising, reduced grip, pain with movement

diseases.name: Frozen Shoulder
diseases.description: Adhesive capsulitis causing significant shoulder restriction and pain. Requires prolonged physical therapy and sometimes surgical intervention.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe stiffness, progressive loss of motion, constant dull ache, pain interfering with sleep

diseases.name: Complete Rotator Cuff Tear
diseases.description: Full-thickness tear of rotator cuff requiring surgical repair. Causes severe functional impairment and constant pain.
diseases.symptomDetails: Intense shoulder pain, inability to lift arm, severe weakness, night pain preventing sleep

diseases.name: Severe Ulnar Nerve Injury
diseases.description: Significant nerve damage causing intense neuropathic pain and functional loss. Often requires nerve surgery and extensive rehabilitation.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe burning pain, complete numbness in hand, claw-like hand deformity, muscle wasting

diseases.name: Humeral Shaft Fracture
diseases.description: Complete break of upper arm bone causing severe pain and requiring surgical fixation with plates or rods.
diseases.symptomDetails: Extreme pain, obvious arm deformity, inability to move arm, swelling, bruising, possible nerve damage

diseases.name: Severe Electrical Burn
diseases.description: High-voltage electrical injury causing extensive internal damage beyond visible burns. Life-threatening condition requiring intensive care.
diseases.symptomDetails: Excruciating pain, deep tissue destruction, muscle and nerve damage, cardiac arrhythmias

diseases.name: Traumatic Amputation
diseases.description: Catastrophic injury with complete limb loss. Requires immediate tourniquet application and emergency surgical intervention to prevent death.
diseases.symptomDetails: Complete loss of limb, extreme pain, massive hemorrhage, shock, life-threatening blood loss

diseases.name: Mild Indigestion
diseases.description: Minor digestive upset from food or drink. Usually resolves on its own or with antacids.
diseases.symptomDetails: Slight stomach discomfort, mild bloating, occasional gas

diseases.name: Constipation
diseases.description: Reduced bowel movements causing mild to moderate discomfort. Responds to increased fiber, fluids, and stool softeners.
diseases.symptomDetails: Lower abdominal cramping, bloating, difficulty passing stool

diseases.name: Gastritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of stomach lining causing moderate pain. Managed with acid reducers, dietary changes, and avoiding irritants.
diseases.symptomDetails: Upper abdominal burning, nausea, feeling full quickly, occasional vomiting

diseases.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diseases.description: Chronic condition causing significant abdominal discomfort and bowel changes. Requires dietary management and medication.
diseases.symptomDetails: Cramping abdominal pain, alternating diarrhea and constipation, bloating, mucus in stool

diseases.name: Gastroenteritis
diseases.description: Viral or bacterial infection causing intense stomach flu symptoms. May require IV fluids if dehydration severe.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe cramping, diarrhea, vomiting, fever, dehydration, body aches

diseases.name: Kidney Stones
diseases.description: Hard mineral deposits causing severe colicky pain as they pass through urinary tract. Often requires pain medication and sometimes surgical removal.
diseases.symptomDetails: Intense wave-like pain in side and back, radiating to lower abdomen and groin, blood in urine, nausea, vomiting

diseases.name: Acute Pancreatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of pancreas causing severe persistent pain. Requires hospitalization, IV fluids, and pain management.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe upper abdominal pain radiating to back, worsens after eating, nausea, vomiting, fever, rapid pulse

diseases.name: Acute Appendicitis
diseases.description: Inflamed appendix requiring emergency surgical removal. Delayed treatment risks rupture and life-threatening peritonitis.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe pain starting near navel then moving to lower right abdomen, fever, nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, rebound tenderness

diseases.name: Perforated Ulcer
diseases.description: Hole in stomach or intestine wall spilling contents into abdomen. Surgical emergency causing severe peritonitis and sepsis if untreated.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden, severe, sharp abdominal pain, rigid abdomen, signs of shock, severe nausea, inability to pass gas

diseases.name: Ruptured Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
diseases.description: Bursting of main abdominal artery causing massive internal bleeding. Most lethal surgical emergency requiring immediate operation. High mortality rate even with treatment.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden catastrophic abdominal or back pain, rapid pulse, loss of consciousness, severe drop in blood pressure, imminent death without surgery

diseases.name: Minor Calf Cramp
diseases.description: Common muscle cramp from dehydration or overuse. Relieved by stretching and hydration.
diseases.symptomDetails: Brief muscle spasm, temporary tightness, mild residual soreness

diseases.name: Shin Splints
diseases.description: Overuse injury common in runners. Responds to rest, ice, proper footwear, and gradual return to activity.
diseases.symptomDetails: Dull ache along shin bone, tenderness, pain during and after exercise

diseases.name: Mild Ankle Sprain
diseases.description: Stretched or partially torn ankle ligaments. Requires rest, ice, compression, elevation (RICE) and possibly bracing.
diseases.symptomDetails: Ankle pain and swelling, mild bruising, difficulty walking, tenderness

diseases.name: Knee Osteoarthritis
diseases.description: Wear and tear of knee cartilage causing chronic pain and reduced mobility. Managed with medications, physical therapy, and weight management.
diseases.symptomDetails: Knee pain and stiffness, worse in morning or after sitting, grinding sensation, reduced flexibility

diseases.name: Meniscus Tear
diseases.description: Torn knee cartilage causing significant pain and mechanical symptoms. Often requires arthroscopic surgery for repair or removal.
diseases.symptomDetails: Knee pain especially with twisting, swelling, stiffness, locking or catching sensation, difficulty straightening knee

diseases.name: ACL Tear
diseases.description: Complete tear of anterior cruciate ligament causing severe pain and knee instability. Usually requires surgical reconstruction and months of rehabilitation.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe knee pain with pop sound, rapid swelling, instability, inability to bear weight

diseases.name: Severe Achilles Tendon Rupture
diseases.description: Complete tear of Achilles tendon causing severe pain and loss of function. Requires surgical repair or prolonged immobilization.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe pain in back of ankle with pop or snap sound, inability to stand on toes, visible gap in tendon, significant swelling

diseases.name: Tibial Plateau Fracture
diseases.description: Break in upper shinbone affecting knee joint. Serious injury requiring surgical repair with plates and screws.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe knee pain, rapid massive swelling, complete inability to bear weight, visible deformity

diseases.name: Acute Compartment Syndrome
diseases.description: Surgical emergency where increased pressure cuts off blood flow to leg muscles. Requires emergency fasciotomy to prevent permanent damage.
diseases.symptomDetails: Extreme leg pain, severe tightness, numbness and tingling, pale or dusky skin, paralysis

diseases.name: Femoral Artery Laceration
diseases.description: Severed major leg artery causing life-threatening hemorrhage. Requires immediate tourniquet and emergency vascular surgery. Can be fatal within minutes without intervention.
diseases.symptomDetails: Catastrophic pain, massive bleeding, rapid blood loss, shock, loss of consciousness, potential death within minutes

diseases.name: Mild Foot Fatigue
diseases.description: Normal foot fatigue from prolonged standing or walking. Relieved by rest and foot elevation.
diseases.symptomDetails: Slight aching in feet after standing, minor soreness in arch

diseases.name: Plantar Fasciitis (early)
diseases.description: Inflammation of plantar fascia causing heel pain. Managed with stretching, proper footwear, and orthotics.
diseases.symptomDetails: Heel pain especially with first steps in morning, tenderness in arch, pain after prolonged standing

diseases.name: Moderate Ankle Sprain
diseases.description: Partially torn ankle ligaments causing moderate functional impairment. Requires immobilization and physical therapy.
diseases.symptomDetails: Significant ankle pain and swelling, bruising, difficulty bearing weight, joint instability

diseases.name: Stress Fracture
diseases.description: Small crack in bone from repetitive stress. Requires rest, protective boot, and gradual return to activity over 6-8 weeks.
diseases.symptomDetails: Localized bone pain, worsens with activity, improves with rest, swelling, tenderness

diseases.name: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
diseases.description: Blood clot in deep leg vein causing significant pain and swelling. Requires immediate anticoagulation to prevent pulmonary embolism.
diseases.symptomDetails: Calf pain and swelling, warmth, redness, tenderness, leg feels heavy

diseases.name: Severe Patellar Dislocation
diseases.description: Kneecap moves out of position causing severe pain. Requires reduction (repositioning) and often surgical stabilization.
diseases.symptomDetails: Intense knee pain, visible kneecap displacement, inability to straighten leg, swelling, deformity

diseases.name: Tibial Fracture
diseases.description: Complete break of shin bone causing severe pain and requiring surgical fixation with rods or plates.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe leg pain, obvious deformity, inability to bear weight, swelling, bruising, possible open wound

diseases.name: Hip Fracture
diseases.description: Break in upper thighbone requiring emergency surgery. Common in elderly and requires immediate surgical pinning or replacement.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe hip and groin pain, inability to stand or walk, leg appears shorter and turned outward, severe bruising

diseases.name: Multiple Trauma with Pelvic Fracture
diseases.description: Severe pelvic break causing massive internal bleeding. Life-threatening injury requiring emergency stabilization and surgery.
diseases.symptomDetails: Extreme pain, unable to move leg, internal bleeding, shock, low blood pressure, possible nerve damage

diseases.name: Traumatic Lower Limb Amputation
diseases.description: Catastrophic traumatic injury with complete leg separation. Requires immediate tourniquet, emergency transport, and surgical intervention. High risk of death from blood loss.
diseases.symptomDetails: Complete leg loss, unbearable pain, massive bleeding, shock, life-threatening hemorrhage, potential death

diseases.name: Mild Muscle Stiffness
diseases.description: Common stiffness from poor posture or prolonged sitting. Improves with stretching and movement.
diseases.symptomDetails: Slight tightness in lower back, minor discomfort with bending

diseases.name: Muscle Strain
diseases.description: Overstretched or torn muscle fibers causing mild to moderate pain. Responds to rest, ice, and over-the-counter pain relievers.
diseases.symptomDetails: Dull aching, muscle tightness, limited range of motion, pain with certain movements

diseases.name: Mechanical Back Pain
diseases.description: Non-specific back pain from muscle or ligament strain. Managed with physical therapy, proper body mechanics, and core strengthening.
diseases.symptomDetails: Lower back pain, stiffness, pain worsens with activity, improves with rest, limited flexibility

diseases.name: Herniated Disc (mild)
diseases.description: Bulging spinal disc pressing on nerve causing moderate pain and nerve symptoms. Often responds to conservative treatment.
diseases.symptomDetails: Back pain radiating down leg, numbness or tingling, weakness, pain worsens with sitting or bending

diseases.name: Sciatica
diseases.description: Severe nerve irritation causing intense radiating pain. May require epidural injections or surgery if conservative treatment fails.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sharp shooting pain from lower back down leg, burning sensation, numbness, difficulty standing from sitting

diseases.name: Severe Herniated Disc
diseases.description: Large disc herniation with severe nerve compression. Often requires surgical discectomy to relieve pressure.
diseases.symptomDetails: Intense back and leg pain, significant numbness, muscle weakness, difficulty walking, loss of reflexes

diseases.name: Spinal Stenosis (severe)
diseases.description: Narrowing of spinal canal causing significant nerve compression. May require decompressive surgery if symptoms are severe.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe back and leg pain, numbness, weakness in legs, difficulty walking, pain improves when leaning forward

diseases.name: Compression Fracture
diseases.description: Vertebral collapse from osteoporosis or trauma. Causes severe pain and may require vertebroplasty or kyphoplasty.
diseases.symptomDetails: Sudden severe back pain, height loss, stooped posture, pain worsens with movement, difficulty standing straight

diseases.name: Cauda Equina Syndrome
diseases.description: Surgical emergency with compression of nerve roots at base of spine. Requires immediate surgery within 48 hours to prevent permanent paralysis and incontinence.
diseases.symptomDetails: Severe lower back pain, bilateral leg weakness, numbness in saddle area, loss of bowel/bladder control, sexual dysfunction

diseases.name: Spinal Cord Transection
diseases.description: Complete severing of spinal cord causing permanent paralysis and loss of all function below injury level. Devastating injury requiring immediate emergency spinal stabilization.
diseases.symptomDetails: Catastrophic pain, complete paralysis below injury, total loss of sensation, inability to breathe if high injury, spinal shock
